data.title: Opera singer Katherine Jenkins on career, motherhood and Christmas
data.meta_description: OPERA star Katherine Jenkins has always had a song in her heart.
data.text:
“I get to see the world and sing with people I always dreamed of singing with,” she smiles. “I used to go to the library and listen to my idols. Now I stand with them on stage.

It’s overwhelming sometimes. I also get to share my dreams with my family. To see it through their eyes always keeps things in perspective. I’m very grateful to them for being the down-to-earth Welshies that they are.”

Away from the stage and the crowds, Katherine treats baby Aaliyah to an intimate concert.

“At the moment her favourite song is Old MacDonald,” she laughs. “As I performed until I was seven months pregnant and she’s heard me warm up so much, she imitates my scales.”

Inspired during pregnancy, Katherine and Andrew have now created an animated children’s TV series that introduces youngsters to the world of classical music.

“Classical music has had such a positive effect on my life,” she says. “I wanted to ignite a passion that I found in music and bring it to children. It’s also nice to create something together that Aaliyah gets to watch.”

Like any career, there have been challenges along the way for the seasoned singer. For Katherine, the trick is balance.

“You want to be the best at your job, but you also want to see your friends and family,” she says. “There was a time when I didn’t balance my life and I’ve learned from that. It’s all about priorities – and my family is at the top.”

Katherine has become an ambassador for the Activia InSync campaign helping women find the best ways to achieve harmony, order and control in their busy lives.

“For me it’s about feeling prepared on stage and being healthy and strong to fulfil my goal of being a good mother and wife,” she explains.

Having just embarked on her Christmas Celebration tour, Katherine will be performing throughout the UK this month. “I’ll be singing a mixture of Christmas classics along with some songs from Celebration and my past albums,” she reveals. “I love a bit of community singing and getting people in the mood for Christmas.”
